## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory buffer. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer">WritableMemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This class is an extension of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, which allows copy-on-write access to the underlying contents. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writethroughmemorybuffer">WriteThroughMemoryBuffer</a></>}>
This class is an extension of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, which allows write access to the underlying contents and committing those changes to the original source. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writethroughmemorybuffer/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// buffer.  In addition to basic access to the characters in the file, this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// interface guarantees you can read one character past the end of the file,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and that this character will read as &#39;\\0&#39;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The &#39;\\0&#39; guarantee is needed to support an optimization -- it&#39;s intended to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// be more efficient for clients which are reading all the data to stop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reading when they encounter a &#39;\\0&#39; than to continually check the file</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// position to see if it has reached the end of the file.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class is an extension of MemoryBuffer, which allows copy-on-write</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="comment">/// access to the underlying contents.  It only supports creation methods that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are guaranteed to produce a writable buffer.  For example, mapping a file</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">/// read-only is not supported.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer/#a4571f3c6ad2b03f15e98bd2ba964888e">WritableMemoryBuffer</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer/#ac16af83479e1c1ae07476634871e2e81">MemoryBuffer</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class is an extension of MemoryBuffer, which allows write access to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the underlying contents and committing those changes to the original source.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It only supports creation methods that are guaranteed to produce a writable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">/// buffer.  For example, mapping a file read-only is not supported.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
